list_definition.definition: a situation in which no further progress towards an agreement is possible

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Talks between the two sides ended in deadlock.

list_ex_of_english: If the match is deadlocked after full-time, the number of players of each team is gradually reduced till a result is obtained.
Both sides are deadlocked and neither gives the public impression that it genuinely wishes to reach a settlement.
Do not let the fight against poverty become the victim of deadlocked negotiations.
Of the seven models taking part in the decision, the issue is deadlocked three for and three against.
However, as we have heard, for months now, despite our best efforts, this matter seems to have been deadlocked.
When they come before us, will we tackle them in a manner that means the two sides facing each other deadlocked?
At present, the whole industry stands deadlocked.
Although some limited progress was made, the gulf between the two sides remained wide, and these inter-governmental negotiations also have become deadlocked.
